intro: Lomaria divergens, commonly known as the divergent lomaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has strap-like, evergreen foliage. Its bulbs are used in traditional medicine, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Lomaria divergens is also notable for its ability to thrive in cooler climates compared to other members of its family.
